You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show Custom Content on the Product Detail Page

Easily add your organization's custom rich text-formatted product content as a tab or widget on the Product Detail page. For example, maybe you want to highlight a product's ethical or sustainable sourcing practices, or you want to provide recommendations for recycling. Create a product tab record, and then create a page section that references the product tab's content.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To edit custom object fields:	Customize Application
To create CC Product Tab records:	Create on CC Product Tabs
To create CC Page Section records:	Create on CC Page Sections
To create CC Page Label records:	Create on CC Page Labels
Edit the picklist values for the Tab field on the CC Product Tab object to include a filter value for your custom content.
Find the fields and relationships for the CC Product Tab custom object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select CC Spec, and then scroll to the Fields & Relationships section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Object in the Quick Find box in Setup, and then select Objects. Select CC Product Tab and scroll to Custom Fields & Relationships.
Click Tab.
Scroll to the Values section, edit the available picklist values to include a key for your custom content, and save your changes.
NOTE This key isn't user-facing on the storefront, but is only used internally to assign product tab content and filter page sections. For example, if you're adding content about your product's sustainable sources, consider creating a value named Source or some other meaningful key.

Avoid the following special characters in product tab picklist values, which can prevent your content from displaying correctly in a page section.

!	*	'	(	)	@	&
;	:	+	=	$	,	.
/	?	%	#	[	]	
Create your custom content.
On the CC Products tab in your org, select a product.
Scroll to the CC Product Tabs related list, and click New.
From the Tab picklist, select the key you previously created, such as Source.
For Locale, enter the storefront locale where you want the content to be available, such as en_US.
For ContentRT, enter your rich text-formatted custom product content.
Save your changes.
TIP If your storefront supports multiple locales, create extra CC Product Tab records for each locale. Select the same value for Tab, but specify a different locale and enter the localized content in the ContentRT field. For example, to create a source tab in Japanese, select Source for Tab, enter ja for Locale, and enter the Japanese content in ContentRT.
Create a page section configured to show the product tab content.
On the CC Page Sections tab in your org, click New.
For Display Type, select Tab or Widget.
If you selected Tab for Display Type, enter the name of your storefront's tab group in Grouping.
NOTE The Product Detail page supports only one group of page section tabs. In the Capricorn Coffee demo storefront, the default tab group name is tabSec.
For Page Name, select ProductDetails.
For Section Name, select Content.
For Section Filter Other, enter the key you previously created, such as Source.
For Location, select Main Content or Right Column, depending on which Display Type you selected.
Enter a Sequence value, specify a Storefront, and save your changes.
NOTE To determine the order of tabs or widgets, B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares the Sequence values of all page sections with the same Display Type and Location. Lower Sequence values display first.
Refresh your storefront, navigate to the Product Detail page for the product that you added the custom content for.

The custom content that you created appears in a new page section. The page section title defaults to a page label placeholder that uses the pattern Head_SectionNameSectionFilter. For example, since you selected Content for Section Name and Source for Section Filter, the page section appears under the title Head_ContentSource. Most likely, you want to update this value to something human readable that fits your organization's buyer experience.

Create a page label record for the page section.
On the CC Page Labels tab in your org, click New.
For Page Name, enter ProductDetails.
For Page Label Name, enter the exact, case-sensitive default value that appeared on the storefront, such as Head_ContentSource.
Specify a Storefront.
For ValueRT, enter the text that you want to appear on the storefront for the page section title. For example, maybe you want to call this section Ethically Sourced.
Save your changes.
TIP
If you localize your storefront, also create a localized page label record.
If you've enabled page label caching, refresh the cache after you modify page label records to show your updates on the storefront.

The page section appears with the updated page label value.

SEE ALSO

title: Show Custom Content on the Product Detail Page
